website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality yet affordably priced entry level grinder that is designed with the beginner in mind.
pros: This entry level glass grinder runs at an impressive 3000 rpm
It has a compact 7-by-7-inch work space that is designed for smaller projects and has a standard 5/16-inch shaft that will accept all standard grinding bits
cons: Because it is for beginners, this glass grinder is limited in scope
If you want to attempt a wide range of projects, consider a pricier model

customer_reviews.title: Don’t order unless you live in Europe
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this grinder, it came with a 220v European plug. Can’t use it in the United States. I’m extremely disappointed. I had a class and needed an extra grinder, this one came in the day before my class. Put me in a ruff spot. This was purchased/sold in the United States. Said NOTHING about having a 220v European plug in its description. WHY WOULD THIS HAVE A EUROPEAN PLUG??? I can’t say it’s easy to clean, easy to use or anything else about this. Besides I’m so disappointed 🙁 It would probably be great IF I LIVED IN EUROPE!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: My first grinder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I am just starting to learn stained glass. I purchased this item based on prior reviews, price and the fact that I may not use it often enough to need a higher quality. Maybe I chose wrong. Again I am new to this artwork. I found that my glass did not smooth out as well as the glass I grinded in class, It may be the bit, I am not sure. Just my review so far. If you are experienced in stained glass or glass grinding you may think my review is inaccurate, I will try a different bit to compare.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G

customer_reviews.title: but it's great. The instructions on how to use the sponge ...
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about buying the cheaper grinder, but it's great. The instructions on how to use the sponge for water are terrible though. Plan to watch a youtube video on "how to set up the gryphette grinder) Aanraku grinding bits fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: K. K

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: Works quite well for a reasonable price. Small footprint works well for a single-person studio.
customer_reviews.author: raven-rock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Everyday Glass Grinder for a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Grinder is everything all the positive reviews said it would be. Very happy with this purchase as it appears, as preceded by reputation, that the Gryphette is solid every day grinder that is half the cost of it's competitors.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyJim

customer_reviews.title: Happy with it
customer_reviews.text: It works great and is easy to clean. Took me a few tries to get it set up right but once I did it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Elgin

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several grinders and this one was sub standard, a lemon. It lasted maybe 6 months. We think there was a flaw in the seal, so water got into the motor, tripped the fuse. We replaced the fuse, burnt the fuse again. It is toast. Can't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Fegert

customer_reviews.title: It's a good little machine.
customer_reviews.text: I like it alot I am still using my Gryfette grinder daily, its helped alot refine the edges of my mosiac pieces glass and tile. I love my Gryphone C40 wet band saw as well.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Machine
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little glass grinder for small stained glass projects. Motor seems strong and have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: That's how they do it!
customer_reviews.text: I have always marveled at precision cuts in mosaics. I'm not a pro and figured I needed practice. No, I need a glass grinder. What a difference. It makes all my cuts so much better.
customer_reviews.author: suwick

customer_reviews.title: Cute & works well
customer_reviews.text: I've had mine for a few days..I'm a beginner with stained glass.. it is easy to use and works well for grinding glass down to size, smoothing edges. Really a game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Leah scarborough

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.text: Great for smaller home projects. Smaller than I realized, but certainly as powerful as the larger ones. Be sure to wear eye protection glass spits back at you a little. Instructions were not very detailed
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Blackledge

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: It works just the way it is suppose to. It's also light weight and easy to move around as I travel.
customer_reviews.author: V. Aune

customer_reviews.title: Just what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Price, size and does its job. Happy with this as a first grinder. Shipped nicely packaged.

customer_reviews.title: Great little grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great little grinder, easy to use. Makes glasswork much more accurate.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: this grinder is really a piece of equipment, it does exactly what it is supposed to do. I especially like the on off button being enclosed so moisture cannot get in.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Worked great, I was able to finish my entire project with no problems from the grinder. Very easy to use and did a wonderful job. I got this one for almost $40 cheaper than similar ones I found locally and it was highly rated. My only suggestion would be to also purchase the splash shield if you plan on doing very much grinding, but that is with any of this type grinder. Safety glasses are also a must using these grinders. I would definitely buy one of these again.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for stained glass projects!

The only advice I have is to cut the sponges in half when using. This grinder works every bit as good as the larger more expensive brands.

customer_reviews.title: Not too shabby
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my primary grinder & it works pretty nice. The only thing i can suggest is that since it's not real easy to constantly drain it...i rigged up a small circulation pump (For about $20) to keep a constant flow of water hitting the grinder bit.
customer_reviews.author: OttoBass00

customer_reviews.title: Lapidary Applications Not just for Glass.
customer_reviews.text: I use this machine for cutting a thin slot around a lapidary stone. It allows the positioning and locking down of a wire around the stone that is being made for a necklace. It works perfectly for this application a creates the right size slot to fit the wire (Silver,Gold, Brass and Copper) into place to be glues or twisted around the stone.
customer_reviews.author: Rock Headed Red Head

customer_reviews.title: Brought my stained glass projects to new heights.
customer_reviews.text: I previously would only cut straight lines for my glass projects because getting curved pieces to all fit together was too difficult using the scoring tools. This grinder has allowed me to begin creating beautiful projects, with curved pieces all fitting together nicely.
customer_reviews.author: icculus

customer_reviews.title: Great Grinder. Back Supplier !!!
customer_reviews.text: Was unable to return this item! From from Seller. The top working area is small. 6 by 6 inch it only good for small items. Spend the extra money and order the 9 by 9 inch working top grinder. The Manufacture of this grinder is a fantastic manufacturer who will stand behind the product because they are covered under a 5 year Warranty!
customer_reviews.author: Dolores

customer_reviews.title: messy
customer_reviews.text: This is messier than I had hoped. I made a little garage from the large box the product shipped in and reached in to do my grinding because it flings glass bits everywhere. I'm sure that's the nature of the beast but it's kind of a drag if you otherwise do glass in your home. It also leaves the glass rougher than I expected and takes longer to shape glass. GIven the cost I thought it'd be a lot faster than hand tools. I'm not sure this adds a whole lot more than my Dremel, though I guess it has a flat surface to hold the glass pieces.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Don't let other commentators discourage you from this project. If used properly (water!!!) it works like a charm. First time project, own design, 15" x 22", 108 pcs, 3/16"tape. Turned out great!
customer_reviews.author: Arne

customer_reviews.title: Does the job with ease. Works well. Grinder bits easy to replace, easy to keep wet.
customer_reviews.text: How I love this grinder! Let me count the ways. I have been doing stained glass mosaics for a few years and this little guy allows me to make custom shaped glass pieces with ease. The grinder bits last a long time if you ensure they are wet when you grind. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon A. Gadonniex

customer_reviews.title: 5year Warranty. Buy it
customer_reviews.text: A little pricey for a mini grinder. but does the job so far. FIVE YEAR WARRANTY. That's my justification for purchasing this model.

customer_reviews.title: Good product, good price, fast delivery.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good price, fast delivery. I am pleased with this product.

customer_reviews.title: Gryphon Gryphette Glass Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like this grinder. It does the job nicely and I just finished a fairly large mosaic using it. I bought this because my space is limited and it's worked out just fine. It does require more frequent cleaning than the larger unit because the sand tends to build up around the grinder but I didn't find that a problem. Overall a nice little compact unit.

Must use the shields on the side or, as someone stated , the glass goes flying. One improvement that could be made? Picture/directions for placing the sponge. I went online and found a video.

product_meta.title: Gryphon Gryphette Glass Grinder
product_meta.description: Size:GryphetteThe Gryphette offers the best value in a glass grinder today. The small enclosure houses a surprisingly powerful DC motor. Even when using 1" diamond bits, it is virtually impossible to stall the motor. The Gryphette is the perfect grinder for the occasional glass artist, student, or classroom. The very low cost and convenient size will be appreciated by everyone who does not require the features of a larger grinder.
feature_bullets: COMPATIBLE - standard 5/16" shaft, accepts all standard bits.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars262 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
